intro: Centaurium minus f. luteiflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered lesser centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to Europe and parts of western Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species within its habitat.
